meanings.definition: Bravi (plural noun): a group of people who are brave or courageous
meanings.sent1: The bravi stood together, ready to face any challenge.
meanings.sent2: We cheered for the bravi who saved the day.
meanings.sent3: The bravi shared stories of their daring adventures around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: Their unity made them a force to be reckoned with, like a pack of fearless wolves.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bravi charging into battle will forever be etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: Bravi (adjective): used to praise a group of people for their bravery or courage
meanings.sent1: The audience erupted into applause, shouting 'bravi!' to the performers.
meanings.sent2: The bravi warriors were honored for their valor in the face of danger.
meanings.sent3: The bravi knights were so brave, they even rescued a kitten from a tree.
meanings.sent4: Their bravi deeds shone like beacons of light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The bravi soldiers marched proudly, their courage evident in every step.

meanings.definition: Bravi (interjection): used to applaud or congratulate a group of people for their performance
meanings.sent1: Bravi! You all did an amazing job on stage!
meanings.sent2: The crowd erupted with cheers and shouts of 'bravi!' at the end of the play.
meanings.sent3: Bravi to the chefs for creating such a delicious feast!
meanings.sent4: Their performance was so outstanding that 'bravi' was the only word on everyone's lips.
meanings.sent5: The audience's 'bravi' echoed through the theater, a testament to the performers' talent.
